Waterbear Field School

Hands-on community workshops teaching energy, water, food, shelter, climate, communication, fabrication, transport, arts & crafts.

Want to take a class? Or teach a class? Please reach out!

info@waterbearfieldschool.org

Our workshops are typically held outdoors, in most weather. Pricing, format, and location vary by workshop and by teacher. Click on a workshop below to find out more!

üì° Communication
February 2026
Greater Boston

Off-Grid Monitoring of Temperature (and other things!) using local, low-power radios

Tracking e.g. the temperature of a hoop house, or the water level in a tank, without using cellular or wifi networks.
Register

Greater Boston

Resilient Small-Scale Electrical Power

Learn how to assess your local electrical needs, and approaches to producing and using small-scale electrical power without the grid.
Register
üì° Communication
February 2026
Greater Boston

Texting When the Grid Isn't Available

Learn how to set up and use off-grid communications tools locally using inexpensive new tools that don't require a license.

Future Workshops

‚Üë Back to Top

Below are some workshops we are considering offering soon. If you'd be interested to attend (or teach) any of them ‚Äî or have ideas for other workshops we might offer ‚Äî please reach out!

info@waterbearfieldschool.org

üö≤ Transport

Bike Maintenance Basics

Learn essential bike maintenance and repair skills for keeping your bicycle in top condition
üå± Food

Building a Cob Oven

Build an outdoor clay oven for baking bread, pizza, and more using ancient techniques. (Image: Wikipedia)
üì° Communication

Building a DIY 4G Phone

Build your own open-source mobile phone with calls, texts, and only the features you choose
üå± Food

DIY Cold Frames

Build a cold frame from reclaimed windows for season extension gardening
üå°Ô∏è Heating/Cooling

Heating Small Spaces Off-Grid

Learn to estimate energy needs for heating tiny homes, animal shelters, and off-grid spaces using hands-on experiments and basic heat transfer principles.
üîß Fabrication

Intro to Sandcasting

Learn the ancient art of casting metal objects using sand molds. (Image: Wikipedia)
üîß Fabrication

Introduction to Welding

Learn basic welding skills while creating a musical Butaphone instrument from a gas bottle
üíß Water

Making Biochar Water Filters

Build a low-cost water filtration system using locally-produced biochar. (Image: Kearns et al, 2023)
üíß Water

Off-Grid Water Level Monitoring

Build solar-powered sensors to track water levels in wells, streams, and tanks
üé® Arts & Crafts

Wire Sculpture

Create 3D forms from wire using techniques inspired by artists like Ruth Asawa and Ariel Matisse. (Image: Wikipedia)
